title._content: ["Près Choisis," Albert Herter house, Georgica Pond, East Hampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Près Choisis," Albert Herter house, Georgica Pond, East Hampton, New York. View from house to orange and yellow garden] [1913 fall] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Grovesnor Atterbury, 1898-1899. Landscape: Adele McGinnis (Mrs. Albert) and Albert Herter from 1898. Other: Later named "The Creeks." The house was on 75 acres given to the Herters as a marriage present by Albert Herter's mother Mary Herter. Today: House, but not garden, extant. On slide (handwritten): "H" and "Herter, East Hampton." Also, gold star sticker and blue star sticker. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16821 Call Number: LC-J717-X109- 16
